e4: While adopting a new unbiased policy may seem virtuous, it might ultimately disadvantage retail investors by making them believe the new EPS is more reliable than it is, causing them to pay the highest price for the share.
e5: An ethical reporting policy would prioritize transparency, accuracy, and fairness. It would not conceal financial performance or mislead stakeholders through selective disclosures. Considerations include considering all types of investors, not just sophisticated ones who may have expertise in navigating such subtleties.
e6: Yes, several more specific requests seem reasonable to understand additional details, including specifics of what is included in "most investors" or how 'the investor community' correctly adjust EPS under current policy.
q9: Oumuamua (also provisionally known by astronomers around the time the query was posed to indicate, and then be replaced with, a more definitive designation)
